responses.rationale: Factual report of a finding without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of an infection; 'highly pathogenic' is a technical term.
Factual listing of case locations/types without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of a non-statement without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of transmission without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of culling using standard terminology.
Factual report of confirmations; 'hit with' is descriptive, not strong framing.
Factual report of confirmation and significance; 'hit with' is descriptive.
Reports existence of 'fear' but does not amplify it or link to amplified harm (psychological verb guard).
Factual report of a non-action without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of situation elsewhere; 'dealing with' is common idiom.
Factual report of culling; 'had to be culled' is descriptive of necessity.
Factual report of circulation and findings elsewhere; 'circulating' is descriptive.
Factual identification of strain; 'circulating' is descriptive.
Factual report of detection without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of findings without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of actions taken by countries; 'outbreak' is standard term.
Factual report of actions taken by buyers; 'outbreak' is standard term.
Factual report of consequences; 'triggered' is descriptive of cause/effect.
Factual report of latest case locations/types without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of detection and action taken; 'culled' is standard term.
Factual report of action taken; 'affected area' is descriptive.
Reports 'likely threat' as a potential outcome description, not amplified fact.
Factual description of symptoms without explicit framing cues.
Presents a severe consequence as a neutral question.
Factual statement about a transmission route without explicit framing cues.
Factual statement about a transmission route without explicit framing cues.
Neutral question about mitigation without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of actions taken by countries; 'outbreak' is standard term.
Factual statement about prevalence being expected (bare negation); 'outbreaks' is standard.
Reports that 'concerns' exist but does not amplify them (psychological verb guard analogy).
Neutral question about comparison without explicit framing cues.
'pretty rare' explicitly frames the human risk as low, triggering Q4 Reassuring.
Factual report of findings and source without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of sequence of events without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of flock type without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of detection; 'highly pathogenic' is a technical term.
Factual report of testing positive without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of non-disclosure without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of detection and detail about number being undisclosed.
Factual statement about 'high mortality rates' as a characteristic, not amplified fact.
'reigniting fears' falls under the psychological verb guard, treated as Neutral.
Factual report of confirmation and source without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of confirmation without explicit framing cues.
States infections are 'concerning' but does not amplify concerns (psychological verb guard analogy).
Factual report of a past event; 'rare case' is descriptive, not explicit calming rhetoric.
Factual description of illness range without explicit framing cues.
Factual report from CDC; 'not known' is bare negation.
Factual description of usual transmission route without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of transmission mechanisms; 'can happen' is possibility.
Factual description of usual transmission mechanism without explicit framing cues.
Factual statement about origin unknown (bare negation) and role of birds ('significant role' is descriptive).
'intensifies' colours a background condition ('ongoing outbreak'), ignored by vivid language guard.
Factual report of infection, flock details, and type ('lethal form' is descriptive, not amplified).
Factual report of past event and consequence; 'impacted' is moderate verb.
